extendedInfo.description: Track Your Progress, Compare & Share with a Worldwide Communityâ¢FitSync, the choice of leading health clubs and professional trainers worldwide since 2001...Read what experts and REAL professional reviewers have been saying about FitSync... MUSCLE & FITNESS: âFitSync gives you the next best thing to a gym buddy... download free training programs, log your workouts and compare your performance against a worldwide community.â LIFEHACKER.COM (Alan Henry): "best in the Android App Market ... Think of FitSync as the heart of your Android gym."MEN'S FITNESS: âAll the tools you demand from a mobile workout companion... hyper-useful with online portals, sync your phone with a FitSync.com account, network with others ... the ultimate workout buddy.â THE BIGGEST LOSER: "Furnished with a impressive library of exercises and workouts to choose from, as well as the ability to create your own, itâs no wonder FitSync is so highly regarded. When youâre not active getting active, the appâs seamless online integration gives you unlimited storage on your FitSync account, meaning all your precious stats are compiled to analyse till your heartâs content."CNET: âFitSync might be just what youâre looking for. FitSync will track and organize exercises, help you put together a solid workout and log results with a tap or two.â HEALTH NEWS: âFitSync is the closest thing to a personal trainer without the large expense and all the yelling.  Downloadable exercise programs, track your progress, log your workout routines on your phone, compare your results to the rest of the country. For the ultimate motivation take the FitSync Challenge and push your fitness goals against friends, family or even strangers across the street or across the globe.â STEPHEN HOLT (ACE Trainer of the Year) âFitSync is perfect for anyone who's serious about getting in shape!â JOHN BASEDOW (Fitness Made Simple): "FitSync ... designed to teach you goal-oriented exercises with helpful diagrams ... how-to videos and record how many calories you are burning ... tracking features keep a log of what workouts you do"With FitSync FREE You Canâ¦*	Create and edit unlimited workouts on your Android*	Add exercises from your personal list *	Search the FitSync Exercise Library of 2200+     exercises, videos, instructions, etc.*	Upgrade to FitSync Premium to get free, unlimited access to over 800 workouts and 100 multi-week programs.TRACK YOUR PROGRESS*	Automatically log target/previous or log new data*	Calculate bodyfat%, BMI, daily calories needs in BodyMap*	Monitor your progress with real-time Charts*	Upgrade to FitSync Premium to access your FitSync Web account and advanced performance analytics e.g. Best, Maximum, Average, Total Volume, Actual vs. Goal, etc.SHARE, COMPARE, COMPETEUpgrade to FitSync Premium toâ¦*	Compare to norms or compete with others in FitSyncâs Global  Rankings*	Share exercises, workouts, and multi-week programs*	Join conversations in the forumsThis free version of FitSync's Android app syncs your data to a FitSync.com Web account but does not include access to the Web account.  Upgrade to FitSync Premium and get access to your FitSync.com Web account with unlimited access to exercise, workout, and program libraries, workout schedule, unlimited storage for your workout data, charts and reports to analyze your performance, and the Premium mobile app version with no advertising.

reviews.title: Boo
reviews.comment: Okay so I get the 1 yr subscription via trial pay n the website yet I STILL have to pay for the premium app?? Pass!!! The Idoo app is way better. Hardly anything in app/website is user friendly. It\'s all confusing at first glance. Nothing is motivational nor appealing to keep using unlike IDOO with their Achievemint point reward system.
reviews.author: Anon Anon

reviews.title: Neat idea
reviews.comment: Neat idea but super basic which is okay if that\'s who the target audience is...yet descriptions are poor and you have to be online for YouTube video links (haven\'t watched).   There are much better apps out there for someone starting out. I  recommend FitnessBuilder but other decent options are JeFit (although some errors)  and Fitness Buddy.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Horrible interface
reviews.comment: The interface to this application is awful.  Looks like they\'ve copied screenshots from their iPhone app. The workout instructions are just dumped in text boxes.  Jefit doesn\'t have the best interface, but it\'s interface is still way better than this app.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Not as advertised
reviews.comment: I downloaded this app after seeing it used in a Verizon commercial. In said commercial it is presented as having workout videos you can follow along to. I\'m not sure whose fault the misrepresentation is, but it is pretty bad. In reality the app is just a work out in text boxes, which is hard to follow when you\'re doing something like yoga. You can\'t get into any sort of flow if you have to stop and read text every pose. The \"videos\" are links to YouTube demos of the pose, and there is no way to link those videos into a workout to follow either. It\'s really a horrible interface, not very useful, and certainly not worth $5.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Not user friendly
reviews.comment: Bad design makes it hard to use. Uninstalled.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: App not calculating correctly
reviews.comment: I input my dimensions, etc and bmi comes up 5547.2... That\'s not me that\'s my house... correct that and rating will be a lot better...
